proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.description

Class OutputConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • proteomicsdb.org.requesttool.model.description.OutputConfiguration

  • public class OutputConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    This class specifies, how and where the received data shall be written.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OutputConfiguration(java.lang.String aFile, java.lang.String aType)
      Constructs an OutputConfiguration, using the given destination flie and type.

      Appends the stringToAppend to the destination file, taking care, that the file ending is not touched by this.

      Returns the flag indicating, whether the user has already been asked if he wants to overwrite the file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • OutputConfiguration

        public OutputConfiguration(java.lang.String aFile,
                   java.lang.String aType)
        Constructs an OutputConfiguration, using the given destination flie and type. The flags doAppend and askedDoOverwrite by default are false.
        Parameters:
        aFile - The destination file to write to
        aType - The type of the Writer

    • Method Detail

      • validate

        public boolean validate(Control theControl)
                 throws CollectedException,
                        InvalidInputException
        This method validates the OutputConfiguration. Actually it just calls the validate method of the Writer, which then takes care of the validating
        Parameters:
        theControl - The controller, which is needed, because in the validating process the user might be asked, if he wants to overwrite the destination file. To ask this question, a reference to the controller is needed.
        Returns:
        True, if the OutputConfiguration is valid; throws an Exception otherwise
        Throws:
        CollectedException - If there are several invalid settings values for the Writer
        InvalidInputException - If the destination file or the type are invalid

      • appendToDestinationFile

        public void appendToDestinationFile(java.lang.String stringToAppend)
        Appends the stringToAppend to the destination file, taking care, that the file ending is not touched by this. This method is used by Control to append the path of multivalued parameters to the destination file.
        Parameters:
        stringToAppend - The String that is appended to the destination file

      • getDestinationFile

        public java.lang.String getDestinationFile()
                                    throws InvalidInputException
        Returns the destination file. If the destination file is the empty String, returns that. If it is something else, but does not end with the correct suffix, this suffix is appended to the destination file before returning it.
        Returns:
        The destination file with the correct suffix, or the empty String if no destination file has been specified.
        Throws:
        InvalidInputException - if the OutputConfiguration has an invalid type

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        Returns the type of this OutputConfiguration.
        Returns:
        The type of this OutputConfiguration

      • getSettingsValues

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getSettingsValues()
        Returns the values for the settings of the Writer of this OutputConfiguration.
        Returns:
        The values for the settings of the Writer of this OutputConfiguration

      • addSettingsValue

        public void addSettingsValue(java.lang.String value,
                    java.lang.String nameOfSetting)
        Adds a value for a specific setting of a [@link Writer} to this OutputConfiguration.
        Parameters:
        value - The value for the setting
        nameOfSetting - The name of the setting that is given the value

      • getDoAppend

        public boolean getDoAppend()
        Returns the flag indicating, whether this OutputConfiguration wants the data to be appended to the destination file.
        Returns:
        The flag indicating, whether this OutputConfiguration wants the data to be appended to the destination file

      • setDoAppend

        public void setDoAppend(boolean flag)
        Sets the flag indicating, whether this OutputConfiguration wants the data to be appended to the destination file.
        Parameters:
        flag - The value for the doAppend flag

      • getAskedDoOverwrite

        public boolean getAskedDoOverwrite()
        Returns the flag indicating, whether the user has already been asked if he wants to overwrite the file.
        Returns:
        The flag indicating, whether the user has already been asked if he wants to overwrite the file

      • setAskedDoOverwrite

        public void setAskedDoOverwrite(boolean alreadyAskedExist)
        Sets the flag indicating, whether the user has already been asked if he wants to overwrite the file.
        Parameters:
        alreadyAskedExist - Specifies, whether the user has already been asked, if he does want to overwrite although the file already exists
